title: Authors and Citation
text: Finley Grover-Thomas. Author, maintainer. Enrique Rodriguez. Author. Bella Peng. Author.

text: Grover-Thomas F, Rodriguez E, Peng B (2025). tidymito: Convenient Analysis Mitochondrial Measurements & Data. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/FiG-T/tidymito.

what: Convenient Analysis Of Mitochondrial Measurements & Data
title: Convenient Analysis Of Mitochondrial Measurements & Data
text: Convenient Analysis Mitochondrial Measurements & Data

title: Convenient Analysis Of Mitochondrial Measurements & Data
text: tidymito aims streamline (mitochondrial) biology research automating common repetitive data processing analysis steps. Initial developments focused reading formatting measures mitochondrial physiology Oroboros O2K High Resolution Respirometer, well general measures individual organism fitness (coming soon). Note: package early development maintained academics, software developers! Please bear us figure things, check outputs reasonable. Let us know like contribute, welcome!

title: Convenient Analysis Of Mitochondrial Measurements & Data
text: tidymito (yet?) CRAN, can install development version tidymito GitHub :
code: # using pak:  # if (!require(pak)) install.packages("pak")   # install from GitHub repository:  pak::pak("FiG-T/tidymito") #> ℹ Loading metadata database✔ Loading metadata database ... done #>   #> → Will update 1 package. #> → Will download 1 package with unknown size. #> + tidymito 0.0.0.9000 → 0.0.0.9000 👷🏻‍♂️🔧 ⬇ (GitHub: 8c991b6) #> ℹ Getting 1 pkg with unknown size #> ✔ Got tidymito 0.0.0.9000 (source) (9.21 MB) #> ℹ Packaging tidymito 0.0.0.9000 #> ✔ Packaged tidymito 0.0.0.9000 (951ms) #> ℹ Building tidymito 0.0.0.9000 #> ✔ Built tidymito 0.0.0.9000 (1.2s) #> ✔ Installed tidymito 0.0.0.9000 (github::FiG-T/tidymito@8c991b6) (65ms) #> ✔ 1 pkg + 33 deps: kept 33, upd 1, dld 1 (NA B) [8.8s]  # OR   # using devtools:  # if (!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools")  #  # devtools::install_github("FiG-T/tidymito")

title: Convenient Analysis Of Mitochondrial Measurements & Data
text: Going Oroboros measurements neat data can bit bit challenge (often requires lot manual selections copy-pasting). read_o2k_oxy_csv() function allows user go straight .csv file exported Oroboros Instrument tibble readings per state. basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(tidymito)  testdata <- read_o2k_oxy_csv(   file_id = "2025-03-03.*.csv", # a patten to match your exported file (or files)   directory_path = "path/to/data/",   exclude_events = c("11As"),  # as this is added at the same time as 11Tm, remove 11As   treat_opening = "after",  # if a chamber is opened during a state, place the window after then chamber has re-oxygenated and closed.   window_sizes = 15,  # if a measurement is taken every 2 seconds, the signal must be stable for 30 (2x15) seconds to pass the cutoff.   change_thresholds = 1,   format_output = TRUE, # select that you want the output tibble to be formatted   sample_identifiers = c("NDi1-OE x gal4", "NDi1-OE ctrl"), # specify your unique sample identifiers   wide_output = FALSE # specify that you want the data to be returned in a 'wide' format.   ) #> Sample identifiers used. Ensure that all filenames have identifiers for both Chambers.

title: Convenient Analysis Of Mitochondrial Measurements & Data
text: encounter clear bug, please file issue minimal reproducible example GitHub.

what: Extract Mean Oxygen Flux Per State From a List of Chambers — o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl
title: Extract Mean Oxygen Flux Per State From a List of Chambers — o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl
text: function attempts automate extraction relevant values tables format Oroboros-O2K output csv. 'Stable' regions within stage SUIT protocols identified, mean values across regions returned downstream analysis. multiple stable regions present, earliest (terms run time) used.  requirements "Stability" can edited using window_size change_threshold arguments.  Negative values considered.

title: Extract Mean Oxygen Flux Per State From a List of Chambers — o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl
code: o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl(   chamber_list,   unique_events,   open_timings,   treat_opening = "after",   window_sizes = 15,   change_thresholds = 1 )

title: Extract Mean Oxygen Flux Per State From a List of Chambers — o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl
text: chamber_list list tibbles dataframes containing raw oxygen flux measurements.  element list must three columns containing information time, event name, calibrated oxygen flux readings single chamber (order). additional columns ignored. chamber separate element list. can generated using o2k_oxy_to_list(). unique_events vector unique events occur window/mean value calculated. include 'open', 'close', 'WARNING'. two events occur simultaneously, second event included. e.g.: "11Tm" added immediately "11As", "11Tm" included vector. events included, error occur output returned. open_timings tibble least one column named 'time'. row contain time chamber opened. treat_opening instances chamber opened state, reading taken "" "" event? Must one two values. window_sizes numeric value specifying size "window" must reached mean values calculated. window size met next event final window size used warning returned. Example.: window size 15 (default) means oxygen flux value must stable 30 seconds (15 x 2 second intervals) mean value calculated returned.  signal never stable 30 seconds (example) final 30 seconds next event used. change_thresholds numeric value specifying tolerance change consecutive O2K measurements. Changes less value considered 'stable'.

title: Extract Mean Oxygen Flux Per State From a List of Chambers — o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl
text: tibble three columns: state, oxygen flux left chamber, oxygen flux right chamber.

title: Extract Mean Oxygen Flux Per State From a List of Chambers — o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl
code: example_data <- o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl(    chamber_list = test_data[[1]],    unique_events = unique_events,    open_timings = test_data[[2]],    treat_opening = "after",    window_sizes = 15,    change_thresholds = 1    ) #> Error: object 'unique_events' not found   # using output from `o2k_oxy_to_list()`:   # get unique events    unique_events <- unique(output_from_o2k_oxy_to_list[[1]][[1]]$event_left)[!is.na(unique(output_from_o2k_oxy_to_list[[1]][[1]]$event_left))] #> Error: object 'output_from_o2k_oxy_to_list' not found    unique_events <- unique_events[!unique_events %in% c("your_event")] #> Error: object 'unique_events' not found   example_data <- o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl(    chamber_list = output_from_o2k_oxy_to_list[[1]],    unique_events = unique_events,    open_timings = output_from_o2k_oxy_to_list[[2]],    treat_opening = "after",    window_sizes = 15,    change_thresholds = 1    ) #> Error: object 'unique_events' not found

what: Format Oroboros O2K Output.csv Into Lists — o2k_oxy_to_list
title: Format Oroboros O2K Output.csv Into Lists — o2k_oxy_to_list
text: o2k_oxy_to_list() extracts data csv file produced DatLab Oroboros O2K. output list three elements. Element one list two elements (left right), contain raw data events left right chambers respectively. Element two tibble containing details chambers opened; third final element vector unique events within run (excluding 'open', 'closed', 'warnings'). results function designed can directly passed o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl().

title: Format Oroboros O2K Output.csv Into Lists — o2k_oxy_to_list
Format Oroboros O2K Output.csv Into Lists — o2k_oxy_to_list
text: csv csv file exported Oroboros-O2K. six columns ("Time s", "Event Name", "Chamber", "Event Text", "1A: O2 flux per V pmol/(s*mL)" "1B: O2 flux per V pmol/(s*mL))" ).

title: Format Oroboros O2K Output.csv Into Lists — o2k_oxy_to_list
text: list 3 elements; list raw oxygen flux measurements per chamber, opening time details, unique events.

title: Format Oroboros O2K Output.csv Into Lists — o2k_oxy_to_list
code: data <- tidymito::o2k_oxy_to_list(csv = "path/to/data/file.csv") #> Error: 'path/to/data/file.csv' does not exist in current working directory ('/private/var/folders/32/lg72_x752993pxg2fvmzrcr00000gn/T/RtmpmJFM6f/filef11472d3e9e8/reference').

what: Format Tibble Output From o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl() Into More Convenient Structure — oxy_tbl_format
title: Format Tibble Output From o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl() Into More Convenient Structure — oxy_tbl_format
text: function extracts information run data, O2K machine number sample IDs user-defined column converts tibble cleaner structure.  can either 'wide' (one column per state, one row per sample) 'longer' (row one state one sample) format.

title: Format Tibble Output From o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl() Into More Convenient Structure — oxy_tbl_format
code: oxy_tbl_format(   data,   info_col = "filename",   sample_identifiers = "NULL",   wider = FALSE )

title: Format Tibble Output From o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl() Into More Convenient Structure — oxy_tbl_format
text: data tibble least four columns: one information extract, one respiratory state, one chamber. info_col character string name column containing information extract. Defaults filename. sample_identifiers vector character strings can used identify sample. example: samples "abc - ctrl" (Chamber ) "xyz - ctrl" (Chamber B), sample_identifiers = c("abc - ctrl", "xyz - ctrl"). identifier must uniquely match specific sample specified information column must contain identifiers samples: correct sole sample ID name duplicated Chambers. wider Whether return wide (one column per state, one row per sample) longer (row one state one sample) tibble. Must TRUE FALSE.

title: Format Tibble Output From o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl() Into More Convenient Structure — oxy_tbl_format
text: tibble containing formatted oxygen flux values.

title: Format Tibble Output From o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl() Into More Convenient Structure — oxy_tbl_format
code: example_data <-  oxy_tbl_format(    data = output_from_o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl,    info_col = "filename",    sample_identifiers = c("NDi1-OE x gal4", "NDi1-OE ctrl"),    wider = FALSE   ) #> Error: object 'output_from_o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl' not found

what: Import Oxygen Flux Data From One Or More Oroboros-O2K formatted .csv files. — read_o2k_oxy_csv
title: Import Oxygen Flux Data From One Or More Oroboros-O2K formatted .csv files. — read_o2k_oxy_csv
text: wrapper three tidymito functions (o2k_oxy_to_list(), o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl(), oxy_tbl_format()) added code links allowing user go .csv file exported Oroboros-O2K fully processed tibble. can applied single csv file multiple files within single directory, cases result single output tibble. .csv files matching supplied regex pattern identified, 'events' (user defined durin run, e.g: addition Proline) identified windows automatically selected based stability oxygen flux readings (completed separately state chamber). Average values per window formatted returned. specified, sample information can extracted .csv file names added output.

title: Import Oxygen Flux Data From One Or More Oroboros-O2K formatted .csv files. — read_o2k_oxy_csv
code: read_o2k_oxy_csv(   file_id = "*.csv",   directory_path = "NULL",   exclude_events = "none",   treat_opening = "after",   window_sizes = 15,   change_thresholds = 1,   format_output = TRUE,   sample_identifiers = "NULL",   info_col = "filename",   wide_output = FALSE )

title: Import Oxygen Flux Data From One Or More Oroboros-O2K formatted .csv files. — read_o2k_oxy_csv
text: file_id regex string identifies input csv files process.  Suggested end ".csv", default set "*.csv" (matching .csv files specified directory).  information regex patterns recommend stringr cheatsheets. directory_path path directory containing relevant csv files. Defaults current working directory. exclude_events character vector events (e.g: addition substrates uncouplers) wish ignore. See o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl() details. multiple events occur simultaneously (e.g 11As 11Tm), one excluded. treat_opening instances chamber opened run, window place event? Passes argument o2k_oxy_list_to_tbl(). window_sizes numeric vector (vectors) specifying window size. Defined terms instrument recordings (.e: Oroboros returns reading every 2 seconds, specified window size '10' equates window absolute terms 20seconds.) change_thresholds numeric value specifying tolerance change consecutive O2K measurements. Changes less value considered 'stable'. format_output TRUE/FALSE statement whether neaten format output. sample_identifiers vector character strings can used identify sample. info_col character string name column containing information extract. Defaults filename. wide_output Whether return wide (one column per state, one row per sample) longer (row one state one sample) tibble. Must TRUE FALSE.

title: Import Oxygen Flux Data From One Or More Oroboros-O2K formatted .csv files. — read_o2k_oxy_csv
text: tibble (either wide, long, unformatted)

title: Import Oxygen Flux Data From One Or More Oroboros-O2K formatted .csv files. — read_o2k_oxy_csv
code: # basic functionality: read in data without specifying any formatting steps or window sizes:  testdata <- read_o2k_oxy_csv(    file_id = "2025-03-03.*.csv", # using provided example script    directory_path = "path/to/data/",    exclude_events = c("11As")    ) #> Warning: No sample identifers supplied, returning unformatted tibble   # basic functionality: read in data without specifying any formatting steps or window sizes:  testdata <- read_o2k_oxy_csv(    file_id = "2025-03-03.*.csv", # using provided example script    directory_path = "path/to/data/",    exclude_events = c("11As"),  # as this is added at the same time as 11Tm, remove 11As    treat_opening = "after",  # if a chamber is opened during a state, place the window after then chamber has re-oxygenated and closed.    window_sizes = 15,  # if a measurement is taken every 2 seconds, the signal must be stable for 30 (2x15) seconds to pass the cutoff.    change_thresholds = 1,    format_output = TRUE, # select that you want the output tibble to be formatted    sample_identifiers = c("NDi1-OE x gal4", "NDi1-OE ctrl"), # specify your unique sample identifiers    wide_output = FALSE # specify that you want the data to be returned in a 'wide' format.    ) #> Sample identifiers used. Ensure that all filenames have identifiers for both Chambers.
